Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the percentage of the vote that Barletta won, stating it as 90% when it was actually 89.05%.
Understate: The claim understates the Latino population of the city at the time, stating it as 50% when it was actually 37.31%.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to verify the statement that Barletta's win was solely due to his support for legal immigrants.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Barletta's win was directly linked to his stance on legal immigrants, without providing evidence or considering other factors that may have influenced the election outcome.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for Barletta's high vote percentage, such as being the only major party candidate on the ballot.
